dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S319 IS: Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program Enhancement Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cornyn (for himself and Mr. Luján) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to review the Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program Enhancement Act of 2025.

section.header: Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program review and report

subparagraph.text: a land-grant college or university; and

paragraph.text: The term land-grant college or university has the meaning given the term in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103).
The term non-land-grant college of agriculture has the meaning given the term in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (7 U.S.C. 3103).
The term Program means the Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program carried out by the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service in coordination with the Texas Animal Health Commission.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture.
Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall offer to enter into a contract with a covered institution to conduct a review of the Program.
The review conducted under paragraph (1) shall include an evaluation of—

subparagraph.text: the effectiveness of the Program in preventing and reducing the spread of cattle fever ticks;

clause.text: the benefits of the Program; and
the burden of compliance with the Program;

subparagraph.text: the treatment protocols developed and implemented under the Program; and
the Federal and State funds allocated to support the Program for the most recent fiscal year, including the funds allocated to each research project associated with the Program.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date on which the Secretary and a covered institution enter into a contract under subsection (b)(1), the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate and the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives a report that includes—

paragraph.text: the results of the review conducted pursuant to that contract; and
recommendations for improvements to the Program, including recommendations for reducing burdens on cattle producers in complying with the Program.
